Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @Sir Seven pushed new version to jl777 branch. it should be able to display p2sh addresses now, you can check by looking at a txid with a multisig address in it. there is also a new api call "addnode", with param "ipaddr", the format is "5.9.102.210" or "5.9.102.210:port"

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: any new bugs?

Author: Sir Seven#7158
Content:
Will check new version soon.
Haven't found new bugs.

Author: Sir Seven#7158
Content:
@jl777c
Instant segfault on addnode method:

```http://127.0.0.1:12986/api/method/addnode
backtrace:
https://paste.ubuntu.com/p/JxNFz6n7rq/```

```curl --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "2.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "addnode", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:12986/
backtrace:
https://paste.ubuntu.com/p/HPvQjx4g2W/```

Author: Sir Seven#7158
Content: bactrace looks same in both cases.

Author: Sir Seven#7158
Content:
Works fine with ipaddr given.
```
curl --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "2.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "addnode", "params": ["159.69.45.70:12985"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:12986/
{"result":"success","status":"ipaddr already there","ipaddr":"159.69.45.70:12985"}
```

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
jl777/komodo branch: jl777
started with `komodod -nSPV=1`
 crashes for the command `komodo-cli getrawtransaction e90ddbca10e04d98526125fd6b68e9b5745323dbcbc7b972b0560d025de3f023`
I know this is not a nspv command but it should give an error message without crashing
backtrace: `https://paste.ubuntu.com/p/np76MJ3rNb/`
@jl777c

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @Sir Seven pushed fix. you didnt have any "ipaddr" field, so it was a null pointer

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @gcharang most all the normal rpc commands will fail in some way or another. @Mihailo will need to add some error checking for the ones that crash in a bad way

Author: Sir Seven#7158
Content: Fixed. Returns error if no parameter given.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @Sir Seven i added libcryptoconditions code to libnspv. i made a script called "onetime" that you run one time. this will autogen and configure and build the libcryptoconditions.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: after you run the onetime script, then just make from ~libnspv and it should build nspv as usual

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i tested this on unix and osx but not windows

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @gcharang can you make a list of the non-CC rpc calls that crash with nSPV=1 mode?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: will do

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Am I understand correct that end-goal for windows is to make .dll file?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: there is 0 win mentions in `cryptoconditions`, not sure what I should expect üòÖ

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: https://github.com/jl777/komodo/blob/jl777/src/cc/makerogue @Sir Seven in general I think just condition with build via mingw as in this script is needed for `onetime` script

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: libnspv windows build script set host env to `x86_64-w64-mingw32` so this `if [ "$HOST" = "x86_64-w64-mingw32" ]; ` condition will match

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i have no idea about windows

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you see the onetime script is simple enough

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and it just needs to link in the libcryptoconditions.la file to nspv

Author: Sir Seven#7158
Content:
In this case, it's enough to run onetime script (or just make libcryptoconditions) and run build_win.sh right after.
In this case nspv.exe works fine on windows, not sure about CC itself.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there is no CC implemented yet, but now it has the cryptoconditions library linked it, it is possible to start adding CC spends

Content:

```make[1]: *** No rule to make target 'src/tools/cryptoconditions/libcryptoconditions.la', needed by 'nspv'.  Stop.                               make[1]: Leaving directory '/data/data/com.termux/files/home/libnsp```
